large we don't know exactly how much

album
we'll be coming out soon his longtime

that the follow-up to question mark was

this is where the difficulties come in
when an artist dies who should get to
decide how to finish their unfinished
work and should their unfinished work be
finished at all many people believe that
once an artist has passed their work
should be left alone there are a lot of
reasons why we might do that
first of all unreleased music is usually
left unreleased for a reason the best

other ones well they don't the process
of choosing which songs get released and
which ones don't is one of the core
principles of intellectual property is

without the permission when they're
alive it's called the leak and no one

it seems to me that the ethical standard
in fact doesn't change but the labels
desire to capitalize off an artists
death quickly takes over so here's where
the worst of posthumous releases arise
unauthorized collaborations and albums
pieced together from throwaway
recordings yes it's possibly wrong to
finish an album for an artist who died
before they could do it themselves but
if done right under the guidance of
producers that knew the artist these

little peep will experience the same

both X and peeps longtime producers
finishing their upcoming albums there's

but it's very very unlikely that either

died unfortunately they almost
definitely have throwaway recordings and

begun and
strangely enough the first instance was
